com.hotmail.kalebmarc

Class HandleError

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hotmail.kalebmarc.jtools.HandleError

  • public class HandleError
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains a variety of methods to handle errors in different ways. Recommended to use in a try-catch block.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      HandleError()

    • Method Detail

      • popup

        public static void popup(java.lang.Exception e)

        Popup full

        Opens a popup window saying there's an error, and displays the stacktrace.

        Parameters:
        e - The caught exception

      • printConsole

        public static void printConsole(java.lang.Exception e)

        Console full

        Prints to the console saying there's an error, then prints the stacktrace.

        Parameters:
        e - The caught exception

      • popupAndConsole

        public static void popupAndConsole(java.lang.Exception e)

        Popup and console full

        Opens a popup window as well as printing to the console, saying there's an error, and displays the stacktrace.

        Parameters:
        e - The caught exception

      • popupCustom

        public static void popupCustom(java.lang.String message)

        Popup Custom text

        Opens a popup window with a custom error message. Does not show stacktrace unless you include it in the string.

        Parameters:
        message - Your custom error message

      • printConsoleCustom

        public static void printConsoleCustom(java.lang.String message)

        Print Console Custom text

        Prints to the console a custom error message. Does not show stacktrace unless you include it in the string.

        Parameters:
        message - Your custom error message

      • popupAndConsoleCustom

        public static void popupAndConsoleCustom(java.lang.String message)

        Popup and Console Custom text

        Displays both a popup window, and prints to console a custom error message. Does not show stacktrace unless you include it in the string.

        Parameters:
        message - Your custom error message

      • popup

        public static void popup()

        Popup Plain

        Opens a popup window saying there's an error. Does not show stacktrace

      • printConsole

        public static void printConsole()

        Print console Plain

        Prints a message to the console saying there's an error. Does not show stacktrace

      • popupAndConsole

        public static void popupAndConsole()

        Popup and Console Plain

        Opens a popup window, and prints to the console saying there's an error. Does not show stacktrace

      • getMessage

        public static java.lang.String getMessage(java.lang.Exception e)

        Get Error Message

        Returns full error message as a string. The template for the error message is:
        Looks like something went wrong!

        Short Description:
        [Description of error]

        More Details:
        [Stack Trace]

        Parameters:
        e - The caught exception
        Returns:
        a full error message as a String
        See Also:
        popup(Exception), printConsole(Exception), popupAndConsole(Exception)
